intro: Psychotria heterosticta subsp. heterosticta, commonly known as the red-eyed psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, dark red berries that are typically consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. The species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in shaded gardens.
